alert.note: Alert for Harney (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 10 at 7:18PM PDT until April 11 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boise has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oregon... Donner Und Blitzen River Near Frenchglen affecting Harney County. .Warm temperatures have caused the snowpack to melt and increase river flows. For the Donner Und Blitzen R...including Frenchglen...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...Donner Und Blitzen River Near Frenchglen. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Floodwater will flow over portions of the access road to Page Springs Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM PDT Monday the stage was 5.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 3.1 feet Thursday, April 20. - Action stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1045 AM PDT.
